dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 5746 IH: Addressing Whole Health in Medicare Advantage Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Bilirakis (for himself and Mr. Blumenauer) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means, and in addition to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to expand the availability of supplemental benefits to certain Medicare Advantage enrollees.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Addressing Whole Health in Medicare Advantage Act.

section.header: Expanding the availability of supplemental benefits to certain Medicare Advantage enrollees

subsection.text: Section 1852(a)(3)(D) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395w–22(a)(3)(D)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the header, by striking chronically ill and inserting certain;
in clauses (i) and (ii), by striking chronically ill each place such term appears and inserting specified in each such place; and
in clause (iii), by amending such clause to read as follows:

clause.text: In this subparagraph, the term specified enrollee means an enrollee in an MA plan that—

item.text: has one or more comorbid and medically complex chronic conditions that is life threatening or significantly limits the overall health or function of the enrollee;
has a high risk of hospitalization or other adverse health outcomes; or

subclause.text: is a low-income enrollee (as specified by the Secretary); or
meets any other criterion determined appropriate by the Secretary, such as criteria relating to social and socioeconomic risk.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply with respect to plan years beginning on or after January 1, 2025.
